We have detected an issue affecting service on the EU-4 region. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. We will update you as soon as we have further information.

An unknown issue occurred with the host agent on one of the hosts in the region, leading to processes being stuck which in turn lead to sites on the affected host being unavailable.

To remediate the situation, our Operations Team evacuated all projects from the host to other hosts in the region and terminated the affected host in order to free the stuck processes.

Most affected sites were recovered in less than 25 minutes.

Unfortunately, in terminating the affected host, any logs on the host were lost. This is because the normal termination signal was not responsive, and our Operations Team had to manually terminate the host.

This was an abnormal situation and we took this action to try get the sites back up as quickly as possible.

To prevent such situations in the future we're implementing guidelines to ensure we retain logs when we manually terminate hosts for incidents such as this.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Our operations team is investigating, and we will provide updates as we work to resolve this issue.

We have detected an issue affecting service on the US-3 region. We are currently working to restore service.

This issue affects multiple production sites as well as development environments. Access to your site, project UI as well as Git and SSH access may be affected.

This outage does not affect Dedicated Enterprise Clusters.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

**Overview**

On March 2nd, at 20:23 UTC an incident was declared for the us-2 region. On-call engineers began receiving alerts for multiple sites down and immediately began an investigation.

**What Happened**

A maintenance operation applied to the storage layer unintentionally resulted in degraded performance for most of the grid hosts in the region. The purpose of the maintenance was to improve the storage layer by switching to an upgraded back end but the migration to this new system resulted in elevated CPU resource consumption leading to a major performance impact on any environment running on one of these affected hosts.

**Resolution**

In order to mitigate the impact of the incident, additional storage layer resources were provisioned and deployed to the region. The migration was able to continue as planned and grid hosts began to recover as expected.

**Impact**

We have paused this same maintenance across all regions to assess how to safely move forward.

This incident has been resolved.

We have released a fix for the storage backend and now region US-2 should function as expected.
Please create support ticket for further assistance if needed.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the cause as related to our storage backend. We are issuing a fix now and will provide updates soon.
We are aware of some projects within the US-2 region that are experiencing a variety of issues. We are currently investigating and will provide updates when we have more information.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. Our cloud infrastructure provider has restored network connectivity across their services.

Our cloud infrastructure provider identified a recent WAN update as the likely underlying cause, and have taken steps to roll back this update. Our monitoring shows signs of recovery across multiple regions and services, and we are continuing to actively monitor the situation.
The issue has been acknowledged by our cloud infrastructure provider, and they are investigating the issue further.

Our monitoring has detected serious issues with our cloud infrastructure provider which affect all sites hosted on the au-2.platform.sh, fr-4.platform.sh and us-3.platform.sh regions and Azure based dedicated clusters. Our operations team has been notified, and they are investigating the issue with our provider.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.

Projects on the us.platform.sh region for which a status change triggers will likely experience downtime. The most common status change events are deployments, and backups. Those events can resolve by themselves but will experience unexpected completion time.
For the meantime, please hold off any activity to your project if possible.

At approximately 10:15 UTC an update to the Organizations component highlighted an issue with our subscriptions API and our testing process. We discovered this update caused improper handling of specific API requests that exposed a small set of non-PII metadata. Once we identified the issue, we rolled back the service as quickly as possible after having briefly put Accounts into maintenance mode to mitigate the possibility of abuse. After reviewing the logs, no more than 10 customers were affected and no PII was exposed.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have become aware of a security issue impacting our web console.

To reduce impact, we are introducing a maintenance window starting now.

This will impact project console availability, but not running environments.

incidents.name: MariaDB/MySQL issues on Platform.sh US and EU legacy regions.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. Our Operations and Engineering Teams have deployed corrected images to these regions, and we are not seeing any issues with backups or branching from environments with MariaDB/MySQL 10.3/10.4/10.5 services.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Our Operations Team is working on a fix for this issue. 

If you are running a MariaDB/MySQL 10.3/10.4/10.5 service in this region. Please refrain from branching or backing up your environment, as the service will not start correctly once this process is completed.

We have detected an issue affecting MariaDB/MySQL service on Platform.sh US and EU legacy regions. Our Operations team has been notified and is currently working to restore service. 

This outage does not affect Dedicated Enterprise Clusters.

We will update you as soon as we have further information.
